title: U.K. Police Raid London Home of Russian Oligarch
description: The National Crime Agency declined to identify the businessman, whose arrest was part of an effort to disrupt the activity of wealthy elites loyal to Russian President Vladimir Putin.

title: Deadly Missile Strike in Poland Exposed Tension Between NATO Allies, Ukraine
description: Some Western officials remain rattled by Kyiv’s initial response to the incident, which appeared an attempt to prod the alliance a step closer to direct conflict with Moscow.

title: Russia Presses Assault in Eastern Ukraine in a Bid to Encircle Kyiv Forces
description: Eastern Ukrainian city of Bakhmut has emerged as a central battleground where Russian forces have worked since August to win, though analysts see limited value in the city’s capture.

title: Russia to Rely on 'Shadow Fleet' of Oil Tankers
description: Whether the world’s biggest crude exporter succeeds in skirting new harsh sanctions starting Monday depends on a non-Western aligned fleet.

title: A Central Bank That Raised Rates Early Now Talks Up Recession
description: The Reserve Bank of New Zealand is encouraging households to cut spending in a bid to quash expectations for more inflation.

title: U.S. and Europe Gird for Trade Spat Over Washington's Push for Domestic Investment
description: European officials say subsidies in the Inflation Reduction Act threaten the region’s economy as it teeters on the verge of a recession.
